page.title: 15 BEST KEPT VILLAGE
page.content: In 1984 Betley entered the Staffordshire Best Kept Village competition for the first time and then again this year.The competition is run by the Community Council of Staffordshire annually and judging takes place in May.There are 3 classes and Betley is in the medium sized villages.In 1984 Betley came third.A sub-committee of the parish council led by Rev.H Armstrong,the former vicar,is responsible for planning a campaign each year to encourage people to keep the village clean and tidy.Both years they organised a competition for the school children to design posters.The winning posters were then displayed in shops and similar places in the village.
